1.text: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of the elect of God and the acknowledging of the truth, which is according to godliness:

2.text: Unto the hope of life everlasting, which God, who lieth not, hath promised before the times of the world:

3.text: But hath in due times manifested his word in preaching, which is committed to me according to the commandment of God our Savior:

4.text: To Titus my beloved son, according to the common faith, grace and peace from God the Father, and from Christ Jesus our Savior.

5.text: For this cause I left thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and shouldest ordain priests in every city, as I also appointed thee:

6.text: If any be without crime, the husband of one wife, having faithful children, not accused of riot, or unruly.

7.text: For a bishop must be without crime, as the steward of God: not proud, not subject to anger, not given to wine, no striker, not greedy of filthy lucre:

8.text: But given to hospitality, gentle, sober, just, holy, continent:

9.text: Embracing that faithful word which is according to doctrine, that he may be able to exhort in sound doctrine, and to convince the gainsayers.

10.text: For there are also many disobedient, vain talkers, and seducers: especially they who are of the circumcision:

11.text: Who must be reproved, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucreâ€™s sake.

12.text: One of them a prophet of their own, said, The Cretians are always liars, evil beasts, slothful bellies.

13.text: This testimony is true. Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;

14.text: Not giving heed to Jewish fables and commandments of men, who turn themselves away from the truth.

15.text: All things are clean to the clean: but to them that are defiled, and to unbelievers, nothing is clean: but both their mind and their conscience are defiled.

16.text: They profess that they know God: but in their works they deny him; being abominable, and incredulous, and to every good work reprobate.
